Package de.wwu.jmrigreenfootinterface.net

Class WiThrottleClient

java.lang.Object
de.wwu.jmrigreenfootinterface.net.WiThrottleClient
public class WiThrottleClient
extends Object
A client for communication with the JMRI WiThrottle server
Author:
Leonard Bienbeck

  • Constructor Details

    • WiThrottleClient

      public WiThrottleClient​(String host, String port, String clientName)
      Creates an instance of this class with the given parameters characterising the connection and login to the WiThrottle server.
      Parameters:
      host - The host of the WiThrottle server
      port - The port of the WiThrottle server
      clientName - The name with which the client should log on to the WiThrottle server. There it appears with this name in a list of connected clients.

    • WiThrottleClient

      public WiThrottleClient​(String host, String port)
      Creates an instance of this class with the given parameters characterising the connection and login to the WiThrottle server. The name with which the client should log on to the WiThrottle server is created randomly. It can be specified using another constructor.
      Parameters:
      host - The host of the WiThrottle server
      port - The port of the WiThrottle server

  • Method Details

    • connect

      public void connect() throws IOException
      Establishes a connection with the WiThrottle server. The constant class variable CONNECT_TIMEOUT_MS serves as a timeout. The client tries to keep the established TCP/IP connection alive. The client is logged on to the server with the name specified or generated in the constructor. A generated, unique ID is sent to prevent confusion with other clients.
      Throws:
      IOException - If something goes wrong

    • maintainConnection

      private void maintainConnection() throws IOException
      Ensures that the connection is (re-)established if it has been lost or does not yet exist.
      Throws:
      IOException - If something goes wrong

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect() throws IOException
      Permanently terminates the connection with the server. The heartbeat transmitter is stopped, the connection is briefly established again - if necessary - to send the logoff command to the server according to the WiThrottle protocol. Afterwards, all I/O streams of the client into the network as well as the socket are closed.
      Throws:
      IOException - If something goes wrong

    • receive

      public String[] receive​(long delayInMs) throws IOException
      Receives data from the WiThrottle server. If necessary, the connection is repaired beforehand or established first. By parameter, a short period of time can be set to wait afterwards (attention: blocking call) before the downstream is read buffered and line by line.
      Parameters:
      delayInMs - A short period of time to wait before actually receiving
      Returns:
      The message(s) received from the server
      Throws:
      IOException - If something goes wrong

    • send

      public void send​(String s) throws IOException
      Sends a message buffered to the WiThrottle server.
      Parameters:
      s - The message
      Throws:
      IOException - If something goes wrong

    • sendHeartBeat

      public void sendHeartBeat() throws IOException
      Sends a single heart beat command to the WiThrottle server
      Throws:
      IOException - If something goes wrong

    • startHeart

      private void startHeart​(String[] welcomeMsgLines)
      Starts a heartbeat transmitter based on the interval expected given in the server's welcome message passed as a parameter. Default interval is 10 seconds.
      Parameters:
      welcomeMsgLines - The server's welcome message

    • startHeart

      private void startHeart​(int interval)
      Starts a heartbeat transmitter with the given interval on a new thread
      Parameters:
      interval - The interval at which the heartbeat command is to be sent

    • stopHeart

      private void stopHeart()
      Stops the heartbeat transmitter. Afterwards, at most one more heartbeat is sent.

    • sleep

      private void sleep​(long ms)
      Lets the calling thread sleep for a while.
      Parameters:
      ms - The number of milliseconds the calling thread should sleep
